alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Coastal Georgetown; Coastal Horry; Inland Georgetown; Northern Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 9:08AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Hanover, Pender, southeastern Bladen, Brunswick, central Columbus, Georgetown and southern Horry Counties through 1000 AM EST... At 907 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wallace to near Lambert. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wallace and Willard around 910 AM EST. North Santee around 915 AM EST. Georgetown around 920 AM EST. DeBordieu Colony and Pawleys Island around 930 AM EST. Litchfield Beach around 935 AM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Atlantic Beach, Atkinson, East Arcadia, Bolivia, Varnamtown, Briarcliffe Acres, St. Helena, Watha, Belville and Sandy Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for southeastern North Carolina...and northeastern South Carolina.
